description:
All you need to know: Curry bread, taro bread, dan tat (egg tart) CASH only.

Don't buy anything inside the display cases, they aren't as fresh as the ones in the giant tower of trays near the register.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Cash only~

Both the normal and Portuguese egg tarts are really good here!! They make them throughout the day so if you miss a batch you can come back later.
author: Ariel Z.

description:
Affordable and delicious Chinese buns!

I like a lot of the buns here: hot dog bun, corn bun, ham and cheese, ham and egg, etc. All of them are really good!

This is a small place, and with their fast and friendly service, it's perfect to go in, get buns, and go back out quickly and easily.

Everything is pretty cheap here, but they only accept cash.

Overall, I really like this place and I'm so glad that it's walking distance to me!
author: Wesley S.

description: Tiny unassuming shop but definitely the best Chinese bakery on Taraval. Their BBQ pork buns and cocktail buns are my favorite. Their egg tarts and Portuguese egg tarts are also super well made and they often run out of the Portuguese egg tarts. Highly recommend if you're on a quick bun run!
author: Mary X.

description:
CASH ONLY. These are pretty darn good egg tarts sold here and I'm glad a fellow Yelper gave me the the heads up on this place.

$1.50 a pop as well which is cheaper than another notable place on my list below.  On the day that I went there was plenty in stock but this places sells out which I guess means I should be counting my lucky stars. I only picked up a couple but the crust was nice and flaky and they keep the egg tarts warm. 

They carry the regular egg tart and the Portuguese egg tart as well. Both of them are pretty darn good. After going to this place I have a new "favorite" for egg tarts. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank places that sell Egg Tart...yes Egg Tart. Obviously given the nature of the food most of these places are in SF or Oakland Chinatown. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen as well (random right?).  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 

1 Mr.Bread
2 Golden Gate Bakery
3 Yummy Bakery 
4 New Hollywood Bakery
5 Ruby King Bakery
6 Napolean Super Bakery
7 Sheng Kee Bakery 
8 Wonder Food Bakery 
9 Sum Yee Pastry
10 Grand Mission Donuts and Bakery
author: Rod M.

description: pieces Portuguese Egg Tart ($1.6/EA)piece cocktail bun ($0.8/EA)piece pineapple redbean bun($1.3/EA)Total cost $8.50  All the Pastry right here are fresh, crisp and delicious, and very Tasty. It'll come back and be worth it.
author: Yingying C.

description:
I like this bakery (dinner rolls, sponge cake, egg tarts but twice I've come and the store is closed during opening hours. The inconsistency is a bit annoying when I go out of my way so I'm giving this place an Ok rating for lack of professionalism/reliability. Giving them a call before you plan to visit is probably the way to go.

Update: Apparently this place is closed for a month but I didn't see a sign.
author: Kristy F.

description:
The Portuguese egg tarts here are soooo good!!!  I never have to long for golden gate bakery/wonder if they are open anymore because mr. bread is so close to my house! Def get the po'tarts here! :P

Service is very friendly! CASH ONLY! I want to try the curry bun next!
author: Tara A.

description:
Mr Bread is a better brand name than Victor's Bakery.  Love their current cute icon of a smiling chef.  The fallout of their previous business turned out to be a blessing in disguise. 

Their Egg Tart (dan tat) is the best on the West side of San Francisco mainly because of their flaky crust.  The egg filling is good also, but plenty of bakeries can deliver good egg fillings. Even I can make decent eggy fills.  However, they've got the perfect crust, together with smooth egg fills, and $1 price, I always buy by the dozen.

Their Portuguese Egg Tart (po tat) has creamy egg fills, like that of creme brulee but without a hard caramel top.  It ain't pretty without the candy top since the top skin chars and thickens from high heat.  The crust is more doughy than it's cousin but that's how it is.  Mr Bread does a good job on this product as well.  Be that as it may, due to the extra creamy calories and heaviness, I control myself on this one.  Cost $1.50
author: Connie W.

description:
Pretty good Lah-

Been coming here since before Bread grew up and donned the prefix Mr., when he was just a man called Victor and lived on the Eastside of Taraval instead of the WESTSIIIIDE.

I used to come up from LA just to pick up sponge cake for the lady and now I'm here at Victor Bread's new spot and they actually produce their sponge cake better than before.

BBQ Pork Pastries are still bomb.

Curry Puffs need more curry like before.

But the Portuguese Egg Tarts...um, by the dozen, please.

Shieh Shieh my boy...Shieh puffin' Shieh.
author: Fourty F.

description: Small bakery.. most people take it to go but there's a few tables. They sell cakes, buns with savory & sweet fillings, egg tarts, etc. Sadly the egg tarts weren't ready just yet when I arrived so I ended up ordering a couple of savory buns. Didn't particularly like the bbq pork bun.. the filling was a bit too sweet and didn't taste quite like char siu. The curry beef bun was delicious maybe because it had just come out of the oven so it was piping hot.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I came here to get some Egg tarts, but they were out.  The Portuguese egg tarts was just hot out of the oven, so I bought those instead.  They were $1.50 each.  These have a semi flaky crust, with a soft and eggy inside.  Delicious.  

It's a small space, so it's pretty cramped at the counter.
author: Karen L.

description:
If you are looking for authentic, traditional Chinese buns around the Sunset area, this is the place. Not only are they cheaper than most places, (Sheng Kee & 85) their flavors and texture are comparable to the bakeries in Chinatown.

BAKE GOODS: 
They sell all the OG Chinese buns, tarts and cookies! They have beef curry bun, cocktail bun, pork bun, Portuguese cheese tart, butterfly butter cookies, and so much more! I especially love their pineapple buns (bo lo bao) and their egg tarts! They also serve bottled drinks. 

SERVICE: 
You line up to order behind the counter where you will pay in exchange for you bake goods. They do speak English (as you will see they have the menu in English too). The line can get long and cramped sometimes, so be prepare to let them know want to order to prevent holding up the line. 

AMBIANCE: 
They have about 3 small tables inside, but it's a very small shop. So it's not really ideal for a order-and-chill kind of bakery. 

This is my go-to spot for those days I'm craving an egg tart or bo lo bao :)
author: Samantha F.

description: Came here to try the Po-Tat (Portuguese Tarts) and absolutely must say its delicious! They serve a variety of buns, cakes, and cookies. The bakery is very small with limited seating but a great option for a quick snack. CASH ONLY
author: Connie C.

description:
Love the Portuguese tarts here. This is probably my favorite spot in the city. They are always warm, creamy and the crust is so flakey. Staff is friendly and accommodating as well. 

Love their baked buns too (I usually get the bbq pork and curry beef)
author: Laurie E.

description: We ordered the Pineapple Red Bean bun, the BBQ Pork bun and Egg Tart. We had to wait a few minutes for the BBQ Pork bun and it was work the wait. Delicious tender pork seasoned perfectly. The best bun was the Pineapple Red Bean though. It was generously filled with red bean and the pineapple topping was so good. The bun was tender and the dough was very flavorful. I will be back! Cash only wasn't an issue and prices are reasonable.
author: Elizabeth O.

description:
My daughter and I were squishy hunting up the street @ Bunny Cafe and noticed many people walking around with pink boxes. Well it was, Mr Bread! Small shop with very tasty pastries. We bought the egg custard tarts, they have super flaky crusts.  We also bought chocolate muffins and the sponge cake, holy smokes they are so soft and delicious. They did not have small boxes of milk but rather soy milk. Overall, We were pleasantly surprised. 
We failed to look at the "Bun Menu." And didn't realize until we left and at that point a line had  formed. Next time, I will definitely return!
author: A B.

description: This five star review is solely for the Portuguese egg tarts. On weekends they usually sell out before 2pm. If you don't see any, ask the lady behind the counter who will ask the kitchen staff if they will make any more for the day. The light sweetness, egg texture and flakiness of the tart is just right. Make sure you bring cash as it's cash only.
author: Donna M.

description:
Walked in to get a cake. Typical asian fruit cake but the bread was not fluffy and light, it was very spongy and almost rubbery. Taste was also very flat, not lightly sweet, as expected. I didn't ask for a second slice (which NEVER happens with these cakes, I'll have at least 3-4 slices and reserve some for later). 
Very nice ladies staffing the store.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Don't order cakes from Mr. Bread. 

I called in on Thursday to order a Thomas the Train cake for my nephew's birthday. They asked for the size, my phone number, pick up time (Saturday by noon), and gave me the price of $43. Today, I went to the store, and guess what... NO CAKE!

After a lot of confusion (the shopkeeper running between the fridge and the back several times) and then getting the person who took my order on the phone, the cake person tells us (my wife and I) that this is a special order cake and I had to come into the store to put in the order. Wtf?!?

Ok, so I get it if the store has a policy to order in person... but, there was never even the slightest mention of that over the phone. And why the hell would you take down my number, pick-up time, AND tell me the price if it wasn't an official order?

On top of completely dropping the ball on the order, you'd think that they would at least offer something for messing up for a little kid's BIRTHDAY who's expecting Thomas the Train on his cake! But no, they suggested we BUY one of their ready made cakes. Really?? You can't even throw in an egg tart with a candle??

Sorry Mr. Bread, if you screw up on my nephew's birthday, and don't offer anything up as an apology, you get a one star review!
author: Rob C.

description: Great place with good prices on freshly made pastries. Some items are still hot from the oven since small batches are made throughout the day. Definitely get your don tats and po tats here, creamy tasty filling with a nice crispy flaky crust.
author: Gary W.

description:
Probably my new favorite place to get egg tarts in the City. Due to the other unnamed one always on vacation and with its ever increasing prices, I made it a mission to find a bakery similar in taste and quality. I know that finding one better would be impossible, but Mr. Bread's egg tarts are comparable at a fraction of the cost as the other place. 

For one egg tart, it's only a buckeroo! That's like half the price compared to the other place. Another plus about Mr. Bread is they sell Portugal Egg Tarts. And like everyone has said, these are pretty amazing. They also sell a variety of other baked Chinese goods here for a very reasonable price. We also tried to curry bun based on the reviews here and it doesn't disappoint.

This is a family owned joint and the lady working up in the front was really nice and friendly. Will definitely be coming back here for my Portugal egg tart and egg tart fix the next time I'm in the City.
author: Jackie T.

description:
had both the hong kong and portuguese dan tats. 

the filling in the hk ones was deliciously eggy, though a bit curdled. the crust was super flaky and delicate, exactly how i like it.

the filling in the portuguese ones was a lot looser than the filling in the hk ones, and so much richer and creamier and milkier. the crust was a little hard on these ones.

both were good (4 star worthy kind of good), but i would love one with the hk crust and the portuguese filling. will have to go back again and hopefully the hk filling and/or the portuguese crust will be better.
author: Heather F.

description:
Got some Portuguese egg tarts and dan tats along with some pineapple buns! They were all good- flaky crust and soft in the middle :) 
I am most surprised by the nice service by the lady at the cashier! She was so friendly and patient unlike most ladies at Chinese bakeries so that was very refreshing! If I am in the area again I would definitely come back to try their other pastries!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Located on the western side of San Francisco in the fog-influenced Parkside/ Sunset District, Mr. Bread is one of many tiny, mom and pop businesses that line Taraval St. near 19th Avenue.

This is a small bakery, obviously doing well with its local support from a mostly residential neighborhood.  We had no clue that this was anything other than another common bakery.  And "common" is a relative term, since we out of towners do not have a Chinese community nearby us, I simply assumed they would be another traditional "American" bakery.   Limited pastry choices, but when we discovered they made humongous Char Siu Baos and Portuguese Custard Tarts, that peaked my interest.  They were delicious. Also, very inexpensive.

We had to make a second check-in there before we left SF.  A dozen char siu baos with a hearty amount of good filling for $6 (that had to be a mistake!!!), and two more delicious custard tarts, made a 400 mile trip to So Cal that day, and I can assure you, they did not last long in this family.

They may be small, they may be relatively new, and they may be under reviewed, but we were happy to become their new customers.
author: Wendy B.

description:
Go there weekly. Love the place. Pork buns, pineapple egg buns, pineapple red bean buns, egg tarts and Portuguese tarts - all awesome.

Unfortunately my daughter once bit into a bone in a pork bun, but that was once in 12 so far. It hasn't stopped her from asking for it whenever we got close by.
author: Alton Y.

description:
Still scarred from an unfortunate pork bun lesson at a Chinatown bakery, I'm no longer tempted to explore similar offerings at other Asian bakeries.  I'll leave that to those with more adventurous palates than mine.  

At Mr. Bread I ceased menu perusal when I spotted "Red Bean Bun $1.10".  It wasn't yet 11 a.m. but they told me no go.  They'd run out.  

I searched again, settling on a Custard Bun.  The bakery worker reached in and, lo and behold, found 1 remaining Red Bean Bun.  How they tell these buns apart is a mystery to me but some things should remain so.  

It's been a long while since I've had a Red Bean Bun and, based on this one, I shouldn't wait so long next time.  "Twas a mighty fine specimen.  

Mr. Bread specializes in Macau pastries.  Having been to Macau when on a trip to Hong Kong, I failed to learn anything about their pastries or even sample one.  All's well though, since they've now come to me.

Macau pastries at a narrow little shop in the fog, a nice long block from Stern Grove.  I'd not go out of my way to come here again but neither would I be disappointed if I found myself here.  That, my friend, constitutes a recommendation.
author: Tracey A.

description: I LOVE the buns here. Especially the taro bun. The bread is so bomb, way better than other buns I've had. I come here every morning I'm in the area, it's just soooo good. Pineapple custard is also solid
author: Jessica L.

description:
Go there whenever I can. Dan tat, Portuguese tat, pineapple buns, curry buns, you name it. Delicious!!!
Small, crowded. Like you were in Chinatown, without the long drive.
Good atmosphere! Broken English is endearing!
GO THERE!!
author: Kai C.

description:
Had to get a cake last minute on a Friday. Called in the morning and they baked me a fresh strawberry cake the same day. 
You cannot beat fresh and under $26!
And super friendly!
author: Alane N.

description: Of particular note at Mr Bread are the Portuguese-style egg custard tarts or dan ta. These ubiquitous cakes are found all over Chinatowns in the USA as well as Macau, Hong Kong and China. One would naturally think their origins are indeed the Orient, but a deeper look reveals these actually are from Lisbon, where they are called Pastel de nata. In Portugal, these tarts have a caramelized top that does not appear on the versions found in Asia or in Chinatown exclaves. That is until I found these at Mr. Bread. I was quite surprised actually that even the sign referred to Portugal, and I was an instant fan. Try these here. They are better than any other I have found, even in the Bakeries on Grant and Stockton.
author: Brian J.

description:
*** In Short ***

Portuguese egg tarts are ON POINT. Oh, wait, sorry, the cool kids all use "on fleek" now, don't they?

*** In Depth ***

I've never been to Macau, so up til now, my golden standard has always been the ones at Sheng Kee, which are super tasty, but, also, super rich. Half is perfect, a whole is a small struggle, and any more just leads to regret. The ones offered at Mr Bread, however, strike a good balance between rich and digestible in larger quantities, while still maintaining a buttery, flaky crust, and rich, but delicately eggy taste. If you were to place Sheng Kee and Golden Gate Bakery at opposite ends of a spectrum, with the former specializing in decadently rich dan tat, and the latter in lighter and distinctively egg ones, Mr Bread falls right in the middle of the two.

I also picked up a BBQ pork bun while I was there, because, well, dan tat ain't real breakfast. This, however, isn't really worth talking about: typical pork bun breading with a decent amount of filling, but a bit too salty for my tastes.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - On the small and narrow side, with some pastries in a display case up front when you first entire, and the rest on the side, forming a narrow corridor with the wall opposite. While there should be enough space to maneuver up front, bear in mind that the corridor is narrow enough that you'll have to back out, as there's no space to turn. Display cases are of the taller variety, but, you're telling the staff what you want anyway, so no biggie.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, and I'm not sure there's a public one to begin with.
author: Johnny W.

description: Amazing Portuguese egg tarts! Was sad that Victor's closed but this is just as good--dare I say...better!? Only down side is they tend to run out of the tarts but worth waiting for the delicious goodness fresh out of the oven!
author: Carina R.

description: I was pretty sad when I heard Victor's had new owners because I've been getting breakfast from there since I was a kid and the new Victor's just wasn't as good. But when I found out the original Victor's owners opened Mr. Bread a couple blocks away, I was so happy again. I always get egg tarts and the ham and egg bun.  I feel like their egg tarts come in 2nd after Golden Gate Bakery in the city. They are baked perfectly, Golden Gate is only #1 because of the buttery flaky shell, but otherwise Mr. Bread is up there with them. And I just love how delicate and silky the eggs are in the ham and egg bun. Definitely my favorite Chinese bakery.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Do you like egg tarts but don't like the high price and wait of Golden Gate Bakery?

Then come here for low prices and no wait.

Just don't come near the end of the day where the evil old Chinese lady in front of you orders the last of them and you go home empty handed.
author: Evan W.

description:
Tiny little shop with only street metered parking nearby or residential parking. Few small tables inside but they are mainly geared for take-away. No outdoor seating.

Came while waiting for friends to arrive on a Sat a little before Noon and many of the buns that I wanted were already sold out. I got a few regardless because I was hungry. The buns ended up being just your standard buns that you get at any Asian bakery. What you want to get here is the Po Tat (Portugese Egg Tarts). I feel they're as good, maybe even better than Golden Gate Bakery without that crazy wait. Now If you're wanting to compare to Macau, it's a good attempt, but not as good.

Cash only
author: Kitty K.

description:
++ Their Portuguese Egg Tart. These are the golden standard I compare all other egg tarts I come across. Perfectly crunchy and flaky crust. Creamy smooth filling. Just the right amount of sweetness. Always warm.
+ Their Standard Egg Tart. Just as tasty, less refined crust.
+ The BBQ pork bun. IMO, good tasting filling and good bread. Currently my favorite BBQ pork bun amongst the countless stores in SF.

= Very small store. Not alot of sit-down seating.
= Decent prices.

Bottom line:
This is a place I would recommend to my friends.
author: Arthur S.

description: Consistantly good chinese pastry. Flavors are not overly strong or oily. Highly recommend the small egg tarts with flakey skin.
author: Ju D.

description: When a local Chinese bakery closed down I thought "Oh darn, I'll have to go far away to get Bao buns." and then Mr. Bread opened up on Taraval. I'm so happy. Whatever I have a taste for Mr. Bread has it: Char Shui Bao, red bean buns, custard tarts, and regular bakery items like apple strudel. Get there early because the good stuff goes fast.
author: Nora S.

description: This place is close by to me so in the morning when I'm in a rush to get my toddler to school and myself to work and don't have time to make breakfast I would drop by to pick up a bun or two for breakfast. The staff there is always so friendly and nice every time they see my toddler and I. I ordered my toddler's birthday cake here once and it was really good. Not too sweet which is great since it was for his classmates and schoolmates. Little toddlers have lots of energy even without the sweets so it was good that it's not too sweet. I would order their cakes again for his upcoming birthday again. I personally like the buns and egg tarts from there too. My toddler loves their sticky banana sticks/cake.
author: Jamie W.

description:
The Portuguese and regular egg tarts are the best. Don't bother waiting in the long line at Golden Gate Bakery. The HK milk tea is also one of my favorites since it is the most similar to the kind you get in Hong Kong cafes.

The regular buns are okay - I think the pineapple bun could be more crispy. It's still good, but I mainly go for the egg tarts. The curry beef bun is pretty special and I haven't seen it anywhere else. The flavor is good, but I feel like every time I buy one there is less and less filling inside.
author: Eliza L.

description: Don't have much to review when all i bought was their portugese egg tart and regular egg tart.  Both were pretty good.  Wished I ate it fresh.  Cute little pink boxes.  The whilpped cream cakes in the refrigerator looked really good and fresh.  Long lines about 7 people when i was there.  Really quick line though.  Lots of regular baked goods.  Such a tiny place with so many goodies.  Great bakery find for Taraval.
author: Helen L.

description:
time: I went there on Saturday in the morning. not crowded at all 
food: hk milk tea, pineapple bun and egg tart. All of them are pretty good
Service: good and efficient. 
All in all, I will come back again if I am around that area.
author: Tina H.

description: The Portuguese Egg Tarts are that best tarts I've ever tasted in my 32 years of life(I've lived in San Diego, New Jersey, San Franciso and now Reno)!!! I can't find one thing I dislike about them. The ratio of crust to custard is perfect. The crust is nice and flaky with lots of flavor. They're very generous with the amount of custard they put in, unlike other bakeries that skimp out. And the flavor of the custard is so rich, creamy, eggy, flavorful and complex. You just can't miss out on these tarts. Unfortunately, I live in Reno and can't access these guys whenever I want, but fortunately that's the case or else I'd eat them all to the death just as fish that don't know how to stop eating fish food. Please stay open forever Mr. Bread!!!!
author: Katherine F.

description: This review just for the Portuguese egg tart... but man, was that good. Better than that other place in Chinatown that's always unexpectedly closed, which shall remain unnamed.
author: Kazu O.

description: They have amazing Portuguese custard tart. If you are coming to buy their egg tarts I would call in and reserve some instead of waiting for the next batch.
author: Sarina J.

description:
Our new favorite Chinese bakery. When I used to live out in the Richmond, it was easy to choose a Chinese bakery - Golden Chariot. Now that we live in the Outer Sunset, it's been a struggle. However, we noticed Mr. Bread recently pop up and we instantly had to try it. We're glad we did! Below are the hot buns we usually get:

Curry Bun - Soooo delicious. Never had a curry bun before, but such a different bun when you're tired of eating the same old chau siu bao. The bread is the same as used in the baked pork bun, with curry beef in place of chau siu. This is the perfect combination of sweet and savory.

Portuguese tart / Egg Tart - My wife loves the po-tats here, but I'm not a fan of any po-tats in general. Their egg tarts are very good and flakiness is on point. Overall though, not better than Golden Chariot.

Phoenix Bun - They're okay. Not very oiley, but not much flavor. I would say they're average.

Pineapple bun - Delicious. Bread is soft, crust is flaky. So much flavor in this thing. They're best when they come straight out of the oven. But that's pretty much a given for any bao.

Pork Bun - Better than average! I only buy the baked ones here. (Not sure if they have steamed actually). If I recall correctly, they don't put the paper beneath the bun. Which is appreciated when I'm super hungry. No soggy paper getting between my teeth when I'm in full blown hangry mode.

Hot Milk tea - we get this less sweet. It's a perfect complement to all baos and they always give it to us in to-go carriers, which is super helpful.
author: Kevin C.

description: This place is so amazing, I almost don't want to leave a review. You know it's legit when there's line out the door even at the butt crack of dawn. They are mostly known for their egg tarts, I believe, and that's usually what I order when I come here. Do yourself a favor and try their Portuguese egg tarts -- they are THE BEST, hands down.
author: Melani T.

description:
Welcome back Mr. Bread aka Victor's.  Ever since Victors was sold to new owners, we've been in mourning and looking for a bakery to make all the family birthday cakes.  After I read that Mr. Bread and Victors were one and the same, I placed an order for a lemon birthday cake.  9" cake is $22. 

The cake was moist and light.  The master baker even piped yellow flowers on my cake.  Hey we don't like the new style fruit on top as decoration cakes.  We like  good old fashioned piped roses!  Cake was just beautiful.

I also bought pineapple buns and dinner rolls.  Those were yummy and not too sweet.

Minus one star for the egg tart.  DH said the egg tart was sort of flavorless.  Portugese tart was yummy but sort of on the greasy side.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Mr. Bread is a transplant of Victor's bakery from across the street, says many of the reviewers. Mr. Bread is long with seating in the back. small storefront. claustrophobic.for me.

drink: coffee (L 1.5)
-better than average, smooth
-not 3rd wave nor farmers/superior

eats: curry beef "turnover" (1.3)
-flakey, small, flavors muted, tasted cold, day old?
warm would definitely be better.

crumbs:
-didn't see entire offerings. pastries on small side, mostly priced..
3.5 stars. nothing wowed today.
author: Victor G.

description:
The Portuguese Tart was ok. It tasted very sweet like the custard was made with condensed milk or something. It's not bad, but I like them more buttery. The crust wasn't very flaky either. It was still crispy but needed more layers.

The milk tea was also just ok. The flavor was in the right general territory, but the tea needed to be stronger and richer. Smile House Cafe is next door, and their milk tea is a little better, but that's a sit down restaurant.
author: Nei N.

description:
Found my new to go spot to get egg tart in the sunset. No more hauling my ass over to Chinatown to Golden Gate Bakery. 

In my opinion, the egg tart was almost or even better than golden gate bakery. I wanted to try the Portuguese egg tart as well, but it was sold out. A new batch was going to be ready in 10 minutes. 

Definitely coming back to try the Portuguese egg tart!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
After seeing the "Yelp Review of the Day", featuring Mr Bread, and also finding out that I was just a block away, I decided to head over to Mr Bread. This newly opened bakery is located on Taraval Street and 20th Ave. 

The bakery offers an array of freshly baked goods. I personally went just for the egg tart. My boyfriend, being Portuguese, was the master taste-tester when we gave them a try. We purchased two, costing about $2.50 (for both). They were fresh from the oven, nice and warm. I really enjoyed them, even though sweets are not really my thing. My boyfriend, being the egg tart expert that he claims to be, said that they were "pretty good"...not quite the same as the egg tarts in Portugal but "PRETTY GOOD". So hats off to you Mr Bread!
author: Aletta B.

description:
Nice, new outer Sunset bakery!

1) First Impression
It was Sunday morning, 9AM and there were only a couple people in front of us in line.
It is definitely a very cramped place, and people had to squeeze by to leave the store.
There's a large selection of baked goods on display and it has a more modern feel compared to Victor's Bakery.

2) Wait time
It only took a minute or two, but of course it shouldn't take too long to order a bun.

3) The Food
My absolute favorites are the corn bun and hot dog buns.
The hot dog bun's crust is actually a bit sweet, but very delicious.
The hot dog is just a hot dog, nothing too special.
What makes this place stand out in my opinion and deserves 5 stars is because of their corn buns.

The corn buns are just very creamy and not dry, since many bakeries usually make it so the center consists of dry corn and barely enough of the sauce.

4) Service
The two ladies didn't give me the typical grumpy Asian look and that was a +.
I have no complaints with the service.
You order buns, you get the buns.

Keep in Mind: 
*Word is that Victor's Bakery owner moved here and took with him the recipes.

*Final Verdict*
If you're looking for a nice, Asian bakery to go to, this is the place for you.
Although new, the people here are very experienced and you will not be disappointed.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
Mr. Bread was formerly Victor's Bakery on Taraval. However, when the lease was up, the owners moved over to the other side of 19th avenue. 

Overall, there are buns that Mr. Bread does very well, and buns that are only so-so. I'd recommend ordering the BBQ pork buns and the egg tarts - These are consistently the best buns in the San Francisco area. It's best to eat them while they are hot and fresh out of the oven (go in the AM if possible). I've noticed a dramatic difference between eating them right when I purchased the buns and waiting 2 hours later. The coconut bun, taro bun, and pineapple bun are so-so. I'll probably try the curry beef bun next time because I enjoyed that when I frequented Victor's Bakery in the past. 

Service is also prompt and friendly-ish. Bonus points if you can speak Cantonese. 

OVERALL: Bring cash. Order the BBQ pork bun and egg-tarts. Eat them while they're hot and fresh (it makes a huge difference).
author: Nicole J.

description:
This is the most tasty bread i've found in the bay area however....

I felt obligated to write this review because I've had the beef curry bread twice from here and each day i've gotten horribly sick. I won't go into details, but it's kept me up all night running to the bathroom. I wanted to blame it on something else, but after I went back and had the beef curry bread again -- i confirmed it was that that gave me the stomach problems previously.

These trips were in split in between 2 weeks

I'm so sad... because the bread is SO delicious... despite the bathroom problems, i would still eat it, but not after this time. I'm in pain... so much pain.

why is everything so delicious but then causes me all this pain...WHY
author: Mimi T.

description: Great execution of Asian bread- crispy in the outside,  chewy inside, and light and fluffy. Our favorite is pineapple custard bun, taro bun and curry bun. We like our traditional steams pork bun so the pork bun here was not great. Pork stuffing wasn't flavorful. Curry stuffing in the curry bun is full flavor and has a nice kick.
author: GgrR K.

description: Its awesome that they open at 6:30 am in the morning!  Great place for a quick stop for baos. I tried both the regular egg tart and the "po tats". They're both good but I prefer the regular since its not as sweet.  They're delicious fresh. I ate a hot dog bun while waiting and they put a large sausage in it! I can see why alot of older asians come by this place in the mornings.  Good value for the price!
author: John C.

description: Yes yes yes yes. Omg yes. Fam and I were looking for some Christmas Eve breakfast and bought a box of the classics - cocktail buns, pineapple buns, and BBQ pork buns.  Pillowy soft and chewy - these are the kinds of buns that make eating Asian bread addictive.  I swear, you take a bite and chew and chew and then suddenly the bun is gone but the foodlust and the high aren't and you must have another.  Great classic Chinese bakery.
author: Tracey L.

description:
Slightly overrated, but the "po tart" is pretty good. However, either the staff is really new or not very knowledgable with their baked goods. We asked the girls what some of the displayed items are, they told us it was BBQ pork flaked pastry so we decided to get one. Then somehow, they packed us the wrong item and charged us for the wrong item. Once they corrected their mistake, went home, it turns out it was some sweet pineapple gel filling thing. Totally wasn't what they thought it was....epic fail.

Looks and taste like your standard chinese bakery shop.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Aw man, got the cocktail bun yesterday and heated up this morning and the filling was disgusting.  I had to spit it out and throw it away.  It was not sweet and just tasted really bad.  Maybe it was a bad batch, but never tasted a bun that bad. Don't think I'll be back as it left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: James L.

description:
Taking the place of Bay Pastries (across from Bank of America) is Mr. Bread, a small, cozy, Chinese bakery owned by the former owners of Victor's Bakery.  There you'll find the tables have already been taken by middle-aged to older Chinese people holding casual conversations all while sipping their cup of black coffee or hot milk tea.  Mr. Bread has your usual Chinese buns, cakes, and tarts: BBQ Pork, Pineapple, Cocktail, Raisin, paper-wrapped sponge cake, egg tarts,etc.  Their signature: Portuguese egg tart: A torched-top egg tart made differently than the usual egg tart.  The delicious creamy tart filling, inside the crispy, flaky crust, is best eaten when warm and out of the oven.

Location is definitely prime, especially for those needing to pick up a quick breakfast while waiting to ride the street car to work or school.
author: Jessica S.

description: I used to b a regular at Victor's .. like almost everyday for breakfast cuz it was across the street from work.  ...I was VERY sad when i went to find they original ppl weren't there anymore ...THEN Mr Bread opened!  Wahoo! I was excited!  They have the best Mahk Sai Goh Baos (mexican bun). Not too sweet n not dry. My mother in law loves the Choong yau bao (onion bun).  Great to know that i can get my carb fix here!
author: LM J.

description:
When the staff at Victor's Bakery on 18th Ave lost their lease, they moved down here. Same pricey little buns at a much smaller inconvenient location. 

The new location is a third of the previous location, needing to squeeze past the 2 tables they set up to get to the counter. They are across from BofA, so can't go grab something while waiting for the bus at their old location.
author: M C.

description: Decided to give this place a try since golden gate bakery always seems to be closed. Service is really friendly. They usually sell out of the tarts quickly. We were lucky to find 8 tarts at 5 pm. The tart is pretty good, not as flaky as golden gates though. But for the price ($1.20), parking and a fixed schedule (only closed on Tues), this is my new place for tarts.
author: Lucas L.

description: Nice & authentic Chinese bakery! They used to be called Victors on the other side of 19th on Taraval!  Even with this move, I still see many of their regulars chilling & enjoying their coffees there in the morning! Nice little bakery to fill your egg tart craving! Service is nice as well
author: Maggie L.

description: As a former fan of the now-closed Victor's, I have been hoping for a new go-to Chinese bakery.  Mr. Bread more than fills the bill!  The curry buns are the best I've had anywhere and I also think the pork buns are great.  The egg custards are flaky and scrumptious.  Next I have to try the Portuguese style egg custards and work my way through their other selections.  Great find.
author: Lois G.

description: I love this creamy goodness called po-taat at this place.   I am not a fan of dan taat and to find this was an absolute heavenly treasure.  Portuguese dan taat.  Like creme brûlée!
author: Donna W.

description:
Came here because it was new and decently reviewed, but unfortunately I came here 30 minutes before closing so a lot of things were sold out. 

However they still had BBQ Pork Buns and they were pretty good. Nice and full of BBQ pork with a thin bun...good stuffing/bun ratio. When I first took a bite I could feel all the air inside escaping too, never noticed that before. After eating one I decided to buy two more! Definitely recommend eating when warm, which is how they are sold.

Not much experience in buying buns at Chinese Bakeries but they were 1.30 each and seemed cheap, other buns that I would try like Cocktail Bun were 0.70. Seems fair!

Would definitely come back to try their egg tarts.
author: Daniel C.

description: The cake is very good here. They have yummy egg tarts. Make sure you buy them when they come fresh out of the oven!
author: H C.

description: Was sent here on a special opps mission and I grabbed a egg tart for me and blueberry muffin. Both were smacking. I walked in and ordered when I back line was out the door. Place must be really popping. Great service the Chinese paddy was very nice to me. Thanks mr bread
author: Donald A.

description:
Came here on a Friday (1/27/17) at around 3:30pm to a line of 3 people plus a few others who came to pick up their called-in orders. Many of the baked goods were sold out and they had stopped baking for the day to close early for Chinese New Years Eve. 

I wanted to get 8 Portuguese Egg Tarts (Po-Tats) to bring home to my family, but they were sadly disappearing before my eyes. I was lucky enough to nab the last one and ate it on the spot. It was the best Po-Tat I have ever had in my life. The buttery crust was light and flaky. The sweet, creamy custard was slightly caramelized. I finished it in 3 bites and immediately wished I had 3 more. At $1.40 a pop, it was so worth it.

Next time, will need to call in for a dozen of these.

CASH ONLY
author: Elaine L.

description:
4 stars for the portugese egg tarts ($1.40/pc)

The regular egg tarts were okay, but very reasonably priced ($1.00 per pc).

I'd come back for the portugese egg tarts!
author: Aleyna S.

description: My mom and I went to Mr. Bread for the first time this weekend to sample their egg tarts -- both the regular and Portuguese variety.  Wow, are they good!  My mom, who has lots of egg tart eating street creds stretching from Macau to Hong Kong, proclaimed these even better than most of the ones she's had in HK!  The egg tarts had a thin crust holding filling that boasted a delicate, velvety texture.  True to the proprietor's Macanese roots, they were not overly sweet.  Mr. Bread has give me a good reason to happily bid the Golden Gate Bakery adieu.
author: Jen W.

description: Came to get a dozen of Portuguese egg tarts for a party and boy was I glad I called in early to reserve a dozen because they were sold out! What I love the most about their egg tarts is the crust - it's not too thick and it's flaky. I can't wait to come back to get more!
author: Michelle T.

description: This place is pretty good, I used to go it when it was on the other side of 19th. It has all your basic Chinese bakery needs and cakes to order to go. I definitely recommend trying the Portuguese egg tart cause once you had one, you can't go back to the regular one. Things here are reasonably priced.
author: Jacky S.

description: This mom and pop shop is my new favorite Chinese pastry joint. Their selling point is that they have the authenticity of Macau bakeries. Their Portuguese egg tart is a must try, hands down probably the best in town and comparable to Macau. The egg in the egg and ham sandwich is smooth and silky. They bring out the fresh bread for you from the back. Tip them if you can!
author: Kenny T.

description:
Review based on Custom Order Cakes (with fondants design) 
I order with her few times before not knowing how the cake tasted! I was sold the moment I look at all her custom cakes. Very detail very pretty. So I order for 2 different occasion 2 months prior.  When I got the cakes it was beautiful and gorgeous! So depending on design the one I got cost me around $135 for a 6in cakes & the other cakes design cause me $170 for a 6in also. When ordering she only has one type of flavor cake which is Vanilla. HERES THE CATCH: the cake doesn't taste like how it look unfortunately :( her custom cake tasted so so dry within the first 2 bites you need something to wash it down with. For flavor wise it taste like a stale/hard sponge cake with very little flavor. Between the layer it's very little amount of buttercream. So I was very disappointed:( when I ask her to put more buttercream on my next cake she can't because she say the fondant won't hold to well :/ I wanted to cancel my second cake design after that but couldn't becauSe I already put down a deposit :( this place is not cheap just really disappointed about the taste & flavor of the cake. DONT BE LIKE ME DONT LET THE DESIGN ON HER PAGE FOOL YOU INTO ORDERING ONE. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. I WARN YA! HOPE THIS HELP! 

OVERALL:
If you think to order a customize cake here just know that what you are paying for is just the look of the cake not the taste. I would pay an extra $20 to get it customize elsewhere at least I know it'll will not only look good but also taste good.  I don't know if her tradition Asian style fruit cake is good or not I never try it so I can't give any judgment on that. However her custom cupcakes was pretty good. Not too sweet at all. But still pricey. For 36 she charges $135 including the design you want. Please notes she doesn't do most of the design because she doesn't have the mold so have a few different pictures to show her but for design wise she's very limited when it comes to that :/
author: Sandy N.

description: Very small bakery but with a pretty good selection of buns, pastries, cakes. We got the egg custard tarts, which were pretty good, $1 each. Next time we'll try the Portuguese tarts.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Pineapple custard bun was PERFECT !! Very warm vanilla rich custard in a perfect pillow of soft dough with that signature crunchy topping. $1.10 is the very best kind of cheap thrill. I don't know how the other stuff tastes, may never find out...unless they run out of custard buns.
Mr. Bread I adore your buns!!
author: Miss F.

description: Must try their Macao egg tars! Love pineapple bun and the HK milk tea. Stop by almost everyday !
author: Sydney Y.

description:
Ordered a few desserts here: 

 Portuguese egg tart- Sweet, browned topping, different crust than usual. Very very oily however. Custard falls apart. Might get again. 

Normal egg tart- bland after tasting the Portuguese egg tart. Custard is much firmer, and the baking leaves it white. Probably won't get it again. 

Service- okay. Long wait when there was only two people in front of us, but there was a long chit chat between cashier and customers.
author: Braden H.

description: Great place to get bread! Everything was fresh and kept warm in their little oven. Things are also reasonably priced :)
author: Alfonso C.

description: A new bakery and easier for me to get to.  WooHoo!  And the family that used to be at Victor's are the ones that just opened up Mr. Bread.  Yippee!  I'm so excited. I didn't realize it was them until after I put in my order for the Chinese bakery standard goodies: char siu bao, pineapple bun, cocktail bun and egg custard tarts. I'll definitely be back since I "need" to try their cream bun, ham and egg bun and many more.
author: J. P.

description: Bought 1 dozen of Portuguese tarts and one dozen of egg tart today after we found out this is the former bakery of victory's, my husband love their bakery and so happy that they reopen. The Portuguese tarts are the best in Bay area
author: Mable L.

description: I ordered a dozen of the egg tarts and Portuguese tarts. They both were fresh out of the oven and piping hot! Fast service!! I love Golden gate bakery alot but they are a but pricey. This place is very good and close by. Will come back again!!
author: Valerie A.

description:
This place is okay. I think it's family run. We got the paper sponge cake which my kids like for $1.50?  

It's a tight narrow space.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Original owner of Victor's down the street.  Best Chinese pastries in Parkside.  

Everything is good.  Ask for what's just out of oven and it won't go wrong.
author: Jing C.

description:
Yummy Asian style baked goods and Portuguese egg tarts!

Boohoohoo, they are now closed Tuesdays starting March 2017.
author: Lil D.

description:
Came here cuz a friend and fb posted about their portugese egg tarts.

We went on a saturday morning...around...9...not busy, a young lady took our order. she wrote everything down (or tried to), maybe one day she'll reach the level of those cool dim sum older ladies that just grab everything and remember everything you ordered just by listening. 

we ordered
the portugese egg tarts- pretty yummy. i wasn't feeling too well so ate them much later but still good....kinda reminded me of...a creme brulee egg tart...first time trying this style egg tart. husband liked it
pineapple bun- normal
bbq pork bun- pretty good
ham and egg- the egg was strange...skip
ham and cheese- at first i realized..what ham..but its baked insideee. OOOO, not bad
curry- it was ok, lots of spice that made it spicy..ish
hot milk tea- strange...like it wanted to be sweet but wasn't really.

overall not bad....she got us the wrong bbq roll but we noticed after we left....with the whole writing down thing...it makes her a little slow, so if there were people. might be a bit of a wait. i would mainly come back just for the tarts.
author: Christine M.

description: Came here to order a 9" inch cake with mixed fruit for a birthday party, the cost was 25.00.  The cake was very moist, freshly baked and not too sweet, just to my liking.  Will come back soon for future cake orderings.
author: April N.

description:
The owner and workers are extremely friendly. I've tried a lot of bakeries around SF. And I can promise you, they serve one of the best Portuguese egg tarts. It tasted really authentic just like
the ones in Macau. Although, it's really hard to get them on the weekend. But you can call them beforehand, they will save you some for you to pick up later. Oh and price wise super reasonable. 

-CASH ONLY-

Just give it a shot if you around sunset district.

PS: I don't work for them, just a loyal customer :)
author: Michelle Z.

description:
A great place for morning pastries.  I have had the pineapple bun, the cocktail bun, and the egg tart.  If I am not mistaken, the owners used to be affiliated with Victor's and since they left, Victor's is not the same.  

I will continue coming here on the weekends for my pineapple buns and egg tarts and will also be ordering a cake.
author: Kevin L.

description: I always come in here in the morning for their pork buns, hotdog And curry buns. This time I went at 4:30 pm to get 6 pork buns. First, the lady said only 3,I said fine. She asked the 2 other ladies behind me in Chinese and counted the remaining pork buns and now she said only 2! Wtf?! I guess you have priority if you are Chinese. I left and said forget it!
author: roderick s.

description: Mr. Bread's Bakery offered quick and convenient treats. The Portuguese tarts were big and sweet. The temperature was just right. The egg custard was also very good. However, the Cocktail bun was a bit too sweet, and the filling was too much. The bread was also dry and not moist at all.
author: Ann H.

description: well I was hankering for po-taat so I called ahead are ordered up a dozen to share with my family and it was a big hit - my sister in law works in Chinatown and said Golden Gate's regular egg tarts cost more and not as tasty (take that!)
author: Mia C.

description: Portguesetarts are to die for. The crust are flaky, and fillings are not overly sweet. The size is perfect.  The coconut tarts are great too. Nice customer service. I would go back if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Carol k.

description: The egg tarts are one of the best that I've ever had!! So creamy and fluffy! The crust was yummy and flaky. I want more!
author: Mertani G.

description: I am a regular here.  I come here at least once a week.  I am your fan since your Victor's days I love your strawberries cake,  Portuguese tarts, pineapple bun, curry beef bun, and tuna bun.  I always give this place 5 stars . I raved about this place to everyone but the last 2 occasions I was disappointed.  On mother days I ordered 2 cakes one is light and fluffy (very good),  one is dense (not good). Just last week I got another cake it was dense and dried (so bad).  Please stay consistent.
author: Lu L.

description: Favorites are Taro Bun, Egg Tart, and Pork Bun. Absolutely delicious and great prices!
author: Hannah R.

description: Ordered some cupcake for my daughter's birthday. Not too sweet like most of the bakery. Definitely coming back for more! On the side note: Their egg tart is very good.
author: Stephy K.

description: Delicious buns, they're all good and very fulfilling and affordable. It's hard to say which one is my favorite! Tasty dessert sets too! I've been getting breakfast from here ever since I discovered this place
author: Nate S.

description: Portugese tarts were the best! love this place!
author: michele h.

description: Bad customer service by the lady.  Ask her to repeat the price she rolled her eyes on me and don't know how to say thank you.  Below average pastries.  First and last time I'm going there.
author: Jake S.

description: Wow!!!! I have had Egg tarts from many Chinese bakeries, but these are amazing!!! I will be back again and again!!
author: dub g.

description: I personally love the banana cake from here. It's really delicious and tasty. The store is quite small but the workers are really friendly. The pastries are pretty good and the price is average for a Chinese bakery. One thing disgusts me. They have cupcakes that say happy mother's day on it which means it's obviously a few months old! That's disgusting. But everything else is fresh! I would recommend the banana cake. It's the best
author: Carissa C.

description: We purchased the Portuguese and standard egg tarts which were tasty. The crust was not soggy and the fillings had the right amount of sweetness. The price was right too. I bought some lao puo bing for my aunt and she said they were not too sweet and delicious. Smaller shop but plenty of options. They offer custom decorated cakes too which looked impressive.
author: Angel D.

description: My favorite place for buo luo bao and other baos. Parking of course sucks but can't get any better in my opinion this side of town
author: Nathaniel L.

description: Tiny shop but amazing Portuguese egg tarts and usually always freshly made. These are by far my favorite go to treat when I feel the sweet tooth kicking in. If it wasn't for calories and sugar I'd probably eat them everyday. The BBQ pork buns are pretty darn good too.
author: Erick M.

description: One of the best sponge cake I have ever eaten! I am not a dessert/cake person but every time we have a birthday, we buy cake here and I finish it all!!!!!
author: Jacky L.

description: Excited to have a quality Chinese bakery closer to the house!  I used to swing by Victor's semi-regularly and was therefore thrilled to see the announcement about Mr. Bread opening on Hoodline.  Brought a batch back for family breakfast and my girls devoured the coconut bun, the hot dog bun, the ham and egg bun and - of course - egg tarts!   The char siu bao was still warm from the oven.
author: Jan C.

description:
A friend of mine told me the egg tarts are so yum at Mr. Bread, so I decided to give it a try. I ordered varieties of pastries.

Portuguese egg tart - it has nothing to do with traditional portuguese egg tart like the ones in Macau. The taste is just like regular egg tart.   

Egg tart - it was just ok. The tart shell is so thin. I like thicker shell which has thousand of layer to make it more flaky. 

Curry Beef Bun - This bun is the best in town.  The curry beef fillings were spicy and smells great.  My hubby normally doesnt eat bun, but he likes it. 

BBQ pork pastry - I hate mushy filling with lots of pork fat in it, but this bun has lot of meat in it that I really like.

Pineapple Bun - it was just so so. It was not soft enough.

Pineapple Bun with red bean paste - Lots of red bean paste in it and it wasnt so sweet.
author: Brielle K.

description: I was in the neighborhood and decided to try this new bakery. I love cake so I decided on a slice of strawberry shortcake. The slice was wrapped in plastic but the cake and cream were not fresh, very dry. I guess I should have known from the presentation in the display case. There was a variety of slices scattered on a tray. I doubt I would go back.
author: Melissa C.

description: we got couple things from here...the egg tart and Portuguese tart did live up my expectation..overall I like the Portuguese tart more..for 1.40 u get a warm and delicious egg tart..i will b back!
author: Jessie L.

description: The egg tarts here are delicious.  Way better than most of the ones in Chinatown.  Catch it when it's out of the oven and you're in heaven.  The pineapple bun and cocktail bun are also delicious.  Well worth a try if you've never been there before.
author: Carlo W.

description: Tried their Portuguese egg tart, BBQ Pork Bun, Ham & egg bun, cocktail bun, pineapple bun with vanilla or red bean.  Their buns were good.  I like their Portuguese egg tart the most out of the listed items.  I will return to try their ham & cheese bun.
author: Steve T.

description: I like this place! Good portion for a lunch. It doesn't cost 5 dollars to be full. Lol
author: Natsuki T.

description: I love the egg tarts and Portuguese egg tarts here. The egg tarts have a nice flaky crust and aren't overwhelmingly sweet, and the custard has a nice texture. The Portuguese ones have a different, sweeter crust (a bit like kougin amann - it's layered with caramelized sugar), the custard is sweeter, and it has a bruleed top. Personally I find it a little too sweet, but it's delicious, so whatever. They're delicious warm or at room temperature, and it's almost impossible to stop at eating just one.
author: Em F.

description: Note to self: the word is out so make sure you give yourself an extra few minutes for that afternoon Egg Tart Run.  Discovered this place by accidentally parking in front of it last month and have been coming 1-2-3 times a week.  Notables are the oft mentioned Egg Tarts, regular and Portuguese.  Golden Gate's tart is a 10, hands down.  Mr. Bread's a solid 8.5 + a 1.5 for the option of sitting down with a cup of decent coffee and enjoying a warm egg tart right out of the oven.  Tart + Experience = 10.  But there's more !  The curry beef pastry was surprisingly delicious.  And there's even more !  The lemon sponge cake roll ... divine.  Soft, perfectly lemony, hint of sugar but not too sweet and moist, moist, moist.  Yes, the egg tarts are on point but other items are on point !  This afternoon they were out of curry beef pastry so I opted for the curry beef bun only to come home and bite into a tuna bun.  Yep, add it to the even-more list.  Excellent tuna bun.  Not mushy, good amount of celery for the crunch and egg white.  Always happy to support small family owned business but not always able to leave 5 STAR review.  This place is dangerously close to home/work and my world is better for it.
author: Beautiful B.

description: Conveniently located on Taraval and my go place for some Chinese baked goods.  The new place is small but clean.I never eat there anyways, its a box it up and go type of place.   Their egg tarts are good along with the pineapple buns etc.
author: Kimmy C.
